an6.114:1.3.eng: Lack of contentment, lack of situational awareness, and having many wishes.

an6.114:1.5.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya tayo dhammā bhāvetabbā.
an6.114:1.5.eng: To give up these three things you should develop three things.

an6.114:1.7.pli: Asantuṭṭhitāya pahānāya santuṭṭhitā bhāvetabbā, asampajaññassa pahānāya sampajaññaṃ bhāvetabbaṃ, mahicchatāya pahānāya appicchatā bhāvetabbā.
an6.114:1.7.eng: You should develop contentment to give up lack of contentment, situational awareness to give up lack of situational awareness, and having few wishes to give up having many wishes.

an6.114:1.8.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya ime tayo dhammā bhāvetabbā”ti.
an6.114:1.8.eng: These are the three things you should develop to give up those three things.”

an6.115:1.3.eng: Being hard to admonish, bad friendship, and a scattered mind.

an6.115:1.5.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya tayo dhammā bhāvetabbā.
an6.115:1.5.eng: To give up these three things you should develop three things.

an6.115:1.7.pli: Dovacassatāya pahānāya sovacassatā bhāvetabbā, pāpamittatāya pahānāya kalyāṇamittatā bhāvetabbā, cetaso vikkhepassa pahānāya ānāpānassati bhāvetabbā.
an6.115:1.7.eng: You should develop being easy to admonish to give up being hard to admonish, good friendship to give up bad friendship, and mindfulness of breathing to give up a scattered mind.

an6.115:1.8.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya ime tayo dhammā bhāvetabbā”ti.
an6.115:1.8.eng: These are the three things you should develop to give up those three things.”

an6.116:1.3.eng: Restlessness, lack of restraint, and negligence.

an6.116:1.5.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya tayo dhammā bhāvetabbā.
an6.116:1.5.eng: To give up these three things you should develop three things.

an6.116:1.7.pli: Uddhaccassa pahānāya samatho bhāvetabbo, asaṃvarassa pahānāya saṃvaro bhāvetabbo, pamādassa pahānāya appamādo bhāvetabbo.
an6.116:1.7.eng: You should develop serenity to give up restlessness, restraint to give up lack of restraint, and diligence to give up negligence.

an6.116:1.8.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya ime tayo dhammā bhāvetabbā”ti.
an6.116:1.8.eng: These are the three things you should develop to give up those three things.”

an6.117:1.1.pli: “Cha, bhikkhave, dhamme appahāya abhabbo kāye kāyānupassī viharituṃ.
an6.117:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, without giving up these six qualities you can’t meditate observing an aspect of the body.

an6.117:1.3.pli: Kammārāmataṃ, bhassārāmataṃ, niddārāmataṃ, saṅgaṇikārāmataṃ, indriyesu aguttadvārataṃ, bhojane amattaññutaṃ.
an6.117:1.3.eng: Relishing work, talk, sleep, and company, not guarding the sense doors, and eating too much.

an6.117:1.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cha dhamme appahāya abhabbo kāye kāyānupassī viharituṃ.
an6.117:1.4.eng: Without giving up these six qualities you can’t meditate observing an aspect of the body.

an6.117:2.1.pli: Cha, bhikkhave, dhamme pahāya bhabbo kāye kāyānupassī viharituṃ.
an6.117:2.1.eng: But after giving up these six qualities you can meditate observing an aspect of the body.

an6.117:2.3.pli: Kammārāmataṃ, bhassārāmataṃ, niddārāmataṃ, saṅgaṇikārāmataṃ, indriyesu aguttadvārataṃ, bhojane amattaññutaṃ.
an6.117:2.3.eng: Relishing work, talk, sleep, and company, not guarding the sense doors, and eating too much.

an6.117:2.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cha dhamme pahāya bhabbo kāye kāyānupassī viharitun”ti.
an6.117:2.4.eng: After giving up these six qualities you can meditate observing an aspect of the body.”

an6.118:1.1.pli: “Cha, bhikkhave, dhamme appahāya abhabbo ajjhattaṃ kāye …pe…
an6.118:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, without giving up six things you can’t meditate observing an aspect of the body internally …

an6.118:1.14.pli: Kammārāmataṃ, bhassārāmataṃ, niddārāmataṃ, saṅgaṇikārāmataṃ, indriyesu aguttadvārataṃ, bhojane amattaññutaṃ.
an6.118:1.14.eng: Relishing work, talk, sleep, and company, not guarding the sense doors, and eating too much.

an6.118:1.15.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cha dhamme pahāya bhabbo ajjhattabahiddhā dhammesu dhammānupassī viharitun”ti.
an6.118:1.15.eng: After giving up these six qualities you can meditate observing an aspect of principles internally and externally.”

an6.119:1.1.pli: “Chahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato tapusso gahapati tathāgate niṭṭhaṅgato amataddaso amataṃ sacchikatvā iriyati.
an6.119:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, having six qualities the householder Tapussa is certain about the Realized One, sees freedom from death  and lives having realized freedom from death.

an6.119:1.3.pli: Buddhe aveccappasādena, dhamme aveccappasādena, saṅghe aveccappasādena, ariyena sīlena, ariyena ñāṇena, ariyāya vimuttiyā.
an6.119:1.3.eng: Experiential confidence in the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha, and noble ethics, knowledge, and freedom.

an6.119:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahi dhammehi samannāgato tapusso gahapati tathāgate niṭṭhaṅgato amataddaso amataṃ sacchikatvā iriyatī”ti.
an6.119:1.4.eng: Having these six qualities the householder Tapussa is certain about the Realized One, sees freedom from death and lives having realized freedom from death.”

an6.12:1.1.pli: “Chayime, bhikkhave, dhammā sāraṇīyā piyakaraṇā garukaraṇā saṅgahāya avivādāya sāmaggiyā ekībhāvāya saṃvattanti.
an6.12:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these six warm-hearted qualities make for fondness and respect, conducing to inclusion, harmony, and unity, without dispute.

an6.12:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno mettaṃ kāyakammaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti sabrahmacārīsu āvi ceva raho ca,
an6.12:1.3.eng: Firstly, a mendicant consistently treats their spiritual companions with bodily kindness, both in public and in private.

an6.12:1.4.pli: ayampi dhammo sāraṇīyo piyakaraṇo garukaraṇo saṅgahāya avivādāya sāmaggiyā ekībhāvāya saṃvattati.
an6.12:1.4.eng: This warm-hearted quality makes for fondness and respect, conducing to inclusion, harmony, and unity, without dispute.

an6.12:2.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno mettaṃ vacīkammaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti …pe….
an6.12:2.1.eng: Furthermore, a mendicant consistently treats their spiritual companions with verbal kindness …

an6.12:3.1.pli: Mettaṃ manokammaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti sabrahmacārīsu āvi ceva raho ca, ayampi dhammo sāraṇīyo piyakaraṇo garukaraṇo saṅgahāya avivādāya sāmaggiyā ekībhāvāya saṃvattati.
an6.12:3.1.eng: Furthermore, a mendicant consistently treats their spiritual companions with mental kindness …

an6.12:4.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ye te lābhā dhammikā dhammaladdhā antamaso pattapariyāpannamattampi tathārūpehi lābhehi appaṭivibhattabhogī hoti sīlavantehi sabrahmacārīhi sādhāraṇabhogī, ayampi dhammo sāraṇīyo piyakaraṇo garukaraṇo saṅgahāya avivādāya sāmaggiyā ekībhāvāya saṃvattati.
an6.12:4.1.eng: Furthermore, a mendicant shares without reservation any material things they have gained by legitimate means, even the food placed in the alms-bowl, using them in common with their ethical spiritual companions. This too is a warm-hearted quality.

an6.12:5.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yāni tāni sīlāni akhaṇḍāni acchiddāni asabalāni akammāsāni bhujissāni viññuppasatthāni aparāmaṭṭhāni samādhisaṃvattanikāni tathārūpehi sīlehi sīlasāmaññagato viharati sabrahmacārīhi āvi ceva raho ca, ayampi dhammo sāraṇīyo piyakaraṇo garukaraṇo saṅgahāya avivādāya sāmaggiyā ekībhāvāya saṃvattati.
an6.12:5.1.eng: Furthermore, a mendicant lives according to the precepts shared with their spiritual companions, both in public and in private. Those precepts are intact, impeccable, spotless, and unmarred, liberating, praised by sensible people, not mistaken, and leading to immersion. This too is a warm-hearted quality.

an6.12:6.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yāyaṃ diṭṭhi ariyā niyyānikā niyyāti takkarassa sammā dukkhakkhayāya tathārūpāya diṭṭhiyā diṭṭhisāmaññagato viharati sabrahmacārīhi āvi ceva raho ca,
an6.12:6.1.eng: Furthermore, a mendicant lives according to the view shared with their spiritual companions, both in public and in private. That view is noble and emancipating, and delivers one who practices it to the complete ending of suffering.

an6.12:6.2.pli: ayampi dhammo sāraṇīyo piyakaraṇo garukaraṇo saṅgahāya avivādāya sāmaggiyā ekībhāvāya saṃvattati.
an6.12:6.2.eng: This warm-hearted quality makes for fondness and respect, conducing to inclusion, harmony, and unity, without dispute.

an6.12:7.1.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cha dhammā sāraṇīyā piyakaraṇā garukaraṇā saṅgahāya avivādāya sāmaggiyā ekībhāvāya saṃvattantī”ti.
an6.12:7.1.eng: These six warm-hearted qualities make for fondness and respect, conducing to inclusion, harmony, and unity, without quarreling.”

an6.120-139:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, having six qualities the householders Bhallika …

an6.120-139:1.20.pli: sāraggo upāsako tathāgate niṭṭhaṅgato amataddaso amataṃ sacchikatvā iriyati.
an6.120-139:1.20.eng: and Sāragga are certain about the Realized One, see freedom from death and live having realized freedom from death.

an6.120-139:1.22.pli: Buddhe aveccappasādena, dhamme aveccappasādena, saṅghe aveccappasādena, ariyena sīlena, ariyena ñāṇena, ariyāya vimuttiyā.
an6.120-139:1.22.eng: Experiential confidence in the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha, and noble ethics, knowledge, and freedom.

an6.120-139:1.23.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahi dhammehi samannāgato sāraggo upāsako tathāgate niṭṭhaṅgato amataddaso amataṃ sacchikatvā iriyatī”ti.
an6.120-139:1.23.eng: Having these six qualities the lay follower Sāragga is certain about the Realized One, sees freedom from death and lives having realized freedom from death.”

an6.13:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are these six elements of escape.

an6.13:1.4.pli: ‘mettā hi kho me cetovimutti bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā;
an6.13:1.4.eng: ‘I’ve developed the heart’s release by love. I’ve cultivated it, made it my vehicle and my basis, kept it up, consolidated it, and properly implemented it.

an6.13:1.5.pli: atha ca pana me byāpādo cittaṃ pariyādāya tiṭṭhatī’ti.
an6.13:1.5.eng: Yet somehow ill will still occupies my mind.’

an6.13:1.6.pli: So ‘mā hevan’tissa vacanīyo: ‘māyasmā evaṃ avaca; mā bhagavantaṃ abbhācikkhi, na hi sādhu bhagavato abbhakkhānaṃ, na hi bhagavā evaṃ vadeyya.
an6.13:1.6.eng: They should be told, ‘Not so, venerable! Don’t say that. Don’t misrepresent the Buddha, for misrepresentation of the Buddha is not good. And the Buddha would not say that.

an6.13:1.7.pli: Aṭṭhānametaṃ, āvuso, anavakāso yaṃ mettāya cetovimuttiyā bhāvitāya bahulīkatāya yānīkatāya vatthukatāya anuṭṭhitāya paricitāya susamāraddhāya;
an6.13:1.7.eng: It’s impossible, reverend, it cannot happen that the heart’s release by love has been developed and properly implemented,

an6.13:1.8.pli: atha ca panassa byāpādo cittaṃ pariyādāya ṭhassati, netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
an6.13:1.8.eng: yet somehow ill will still occupies the mind.

an6.13:1.9.eng: For it is the heart’s release by love that is the escape from ill will.’

an6.13:2.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya:

an6.13:2.2.pli: ‘karuṇā hi kho me cetovimutti bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā;
an6.13:2.2.eng: ‘I’ve developed the heart’s release by compassion. I’ve cultivated it, made it my vehicle and my basis, kept it up, consolidated it, and properly implemented it.

an6.13:2.3.pli: atha ca pana me vihesā cittaṃ pariyādāya tiṭṭhatī’ti.
an6.13:2.3.eng: Yet somehow the thought of harming still occupies my mind.’

an6.13:2.4.pli: So ‘mā hevan’tissa vacanīyo: ‘māyasmā evaṃ avaca; mā bhagavantaṃ abbhācikkhi, na hi sādhu bhagavato abbhakkhānaṃ, na hi bhagavā evaṃ vadeyya.
an6.13:2.4.eng: They should be told, ‘Not so, venerable! …

an6.13:2.5.pli: Aṭṭhānametaṃ, āvuso, anavakāso yaṃ karuṇāya cetovimuttiyā bhāvitāya bahulīkatāya yānīkatāya vatthukatāya anuṭṭhitāya paricitāya susamāraddhāya;

an6.13:2.6.pli: atha ca panassa vihesā cittaṃ pariyādāya ṭhassati, netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.

an6.13:2.7.eng: For it is the heart’s release by compassion that is the escape from thoughts of harming.’

an6.13:3.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya:

an6.13:3.2.pli: ‘muditā hi kho me cetovimutti bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā;
an6.13:3.2.eng: ‘I’ve developed the heart’s release by rejoicing. I’ve cultivated it, made it my vehicle and my basis, kept it up, consolidated it, and properly implemented it.

an6.13:3.3.pli: atha ca pana me arati cittaṃ pariyādāya tiṭṭhatī’ti.
an6.13:3.3.eng: Yet somehow discontent still occupies my mind.’

an6.13:3.4.pli: So ‘mā hevan’tissa vacanīyo: ‘māyasmā evaṃ avaca; mā bhagavantaṃ abbhācikkhi, na hi sādhu bhagavato abbhakkhānaṃ, na hi bhagavā evaṃ vadeyya.
an6.13:3.4.eng: They should be told, ‘Not so, venerable! …

an6.13:3.5.pli: Aṭṭhānametaṃ, āvuso, anavakāso yaṃ muditāya cetovimuttiyā bhāvitāya bahulīkatāya yānīkatāya vatthukatāya anuṭṭhitāya paricitāya susamāraddhāya;

an6.13:3.6.pli: atha ca panassa arati cittaṃ pariyādāya ṭhassati, netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.

an6.13:3.7.eng: For it is the heart’s release by rejoicing that is the escape from discontent.’

an6.13:4.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya:

an6.13:4.2.pli: ‘upekkhā hi kho me cetovimutti bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā;
an6.13:4.2.eng: ‘I’ve developed the heart’s release by equanimity. I’ve cultivated it, made it my vehicle and my basis, kept it up, consolidated it, and properly implemented it.

an6.13:4.3.pli: atha ca pana me rāgo cittaṃ pariyādāya tiṭṭhatī’ti.
an6.13:4.3.eng: Yet somehow desire still occupies my mind.’

an6.13:4.4.pli: So ‘mā hevan’tissa vacanīyo: ‘māyasmā evaṃ avaca; mā bhagavantaṃ abbhācikkhi, na hi sādhu bhagavato abbhakkhānaṃ, na hi bhagavā evaṃ vadeyya.
an6.13:4.4.eng: They should be told, ‘Not so, venerable! …

an6.13:4.5.pli: Aṭṭhānametaṃ, āvuso, anavakāso yaṃ upekkhāya cetovimuttiyā bhāvitāya bahulīkatāya yānīkatāya vatthukatāya anuṭṭhitāya paricitāya susamāraddhāya;

an6.13:4.6.pli: atha ca panassa rāgo cittaṃ pariyādāya ṭhassati, netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.

an6.13:4.7.eng: For it is the heart’s release by equanimity that is the escape from desire.’

an6.13:5.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya:

an6.13:5.2.pli: ‘animittā hi kho me cetovimutti bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā;
an6.13:5.2.eng: ‘I’ve developed the signless release of the heart. I’ve cultivated it, made it my vehicle and my basis, kept it up, consolidated it, and properly implemented it.

an6.13:5.3.pli: atha ca pana me nimittānusāri viññāṇaṃ hotī’ti.
an6.13:5.3.eng: Yet somehow my consciousness still follows after signs.’

an6.13:5.4.pli: So ‘mā hevan’tissa vacanīyo: ‘māyasmā evaṃ avaca; mā bhagavantaṃ abbhācikkhi, na hi sādhu bhagavato abbhakkhānaṃ, na hi bhagavā evaṃ vadeyya.
an6.13:5.4.eng: They should be told, ‘Not so, venerable! …

an6.13:5.5.pli: Aṭṭhānametaṃ, āvuso, anavakāso yaṃ animittāya cetovimuttiyā bhāvitāya bahulīkatāya yānīkatāya vatthukatāya anuṭṭhitāya paricitāya susamāraddhāya;

an6.13:5.6.pli: atha ca panassa nimittānusāri viññāṇaṃ bhavissati, netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.

an6.13:5.7.eng: For it is the signless release of the heart that is the escape from all signs.’

an6.13:6.1.pli: Idha pana bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya:

an6.13:6.2.pli: ‘asmīti kho me vigataṃ, ayamahamasmīti ca na samanupassāmi;
an6.13:6.2.eng: ‘I’m rid of the conceit “I am”. And I don’t regard anything as “I am this”.

an6.13:6.3.pli: atha ca pana me vicikicchākathaṅkathāsallaṃ cittaṃ pariyādāya tiṭṭhatī’ti.
an6.13:6.3.eng: Yet somehow the dart of doubt and indecision still occupies my mind.’

an6.13:6.4.pli: So ‘mā hevan’tissa vacanīyo: ‘māyasmā evaṃ avaca; mā bhagavantaṃ abbhācikkhi, na hi sādhu bhagavato abbhakkhānaṃ, na hi bhagavā evaṃ vadeyya.
an6.13:6.4.eng: They should be told, ‘Not so, venerable! Don’t say that. Don’t misrepresent the Buddha, for misrepresentation of the Buddha is not good. And the Buddha would not say that.

an6.13:6.5.pli: Aṭṭhānametaṃ, āvuso, anavakāso yaṃ asmīti vigate ayamahamasmīti ca na samanupassato;
an6.13:6.5.eng: It’s impossible, reverend, it cannot happen that the conceit “I am” has been done away with, and nothing is regarded as “I am this”,

an6.13:6.6.pli: atha ca panassa vicikicchākathaṅkathāsallaṃ cittaṃ pariyādāya ṭhassati, netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
an6.13:6.6.eng: yet somehow the dart of doubt and indecision still occupies the mind.

an6.13:6.7.pli: Nissaraṇañhetaṃ, āvuso, vicikicchākathaṅkathāsallassa yadidaṃ asmīti mānasamugghāto’ti.
an6.13:6.7.eng: For it is the uprooting of the conceit “I am” that is the escape from the dart of doubt and indecision.’

an6.13:7.1.pli: Imā kho, bhikkhave, cha nissāraṇīyā dhātuyo”ti.
an6.13:7.1.eng: These are the six elements of escape.”

an6.14:1.1.pli: Tatra kho āyasmā sāriputto bhikkhū āmantesi:

an6.14:1.3.pli: “Āvuso”ti kho te bhikkhū āyasmato sāriputtassa paccassosuṃ.

an6.14:2.1.pli: “Tathā tathā, āvuso, bhikkhu vihāraṃ kappeti yathā yathāssa vihāraṃ kappayato na bhaddakaṃ maraṇaṃ hoti, na bhaddikā kālakiriyā.
an6.14:2.1.eng: “A mendicant lives life so as to not have a good death.

an6.14:2.2.pli: Kathañcāvuso, bhikkhu tathā tathā vihāraṃ kappeti yathā yathāssa vihāraṃ kappayato na bhaddakaṃ maraṇaṃ hoti, na bhaddikā kālakiriyā?
an6.14:2.2.eng: And how do they live life so as to not have a good death?

an6.14:3.1.pli: Idhāvuso, bhikkhu kammārāmo hoti kammarato kammārāmataṃ anuyutto, bhassārāmo hoti bhassarato bhassārāmataṃ anuyutto, niddārāmo hoti niddārato niddārāmataṃ anuyutto, saṅgaṇikārāmo hoti saṅgaṇikarato saṅgaṇikārāmataṃ anuyutto, saṃsaggārāmo hoti saṃsaggarato saṃsaggārāmataṃ anuyutto, papañcārāmo hoti papañcarato papañcārāmataṃ anuyutto.
an6.14:3.1.eng: Take a mendicant who relishes work, talk, sleep, company, closeness, and proliferation. They love these things and like to relish them.

an6.14:3.2.pli: Evaṃ kho, āvuso, bhikkhu tathā tathā vihāraṃ kappeti yathā yathāssa vihāraṃ kappayato na bhaddakaṃ maraṇaṃ hoti, na bhaddikā kālakiriyā.
an6.14:3.2.eng: A mendicant who lives life like this does not have a good death.

an6.14:3.4.pli: ‘bhikkhu sakkāyābhirato nappajahāsi sakkāyaṃ sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāya’.
an6.14:3.4.eng: a mendicant who enjoys substantial reality, who hasn’t given up substantial reality to rightly make an end of suffering.

an6.14:4.1.pli: Tathā tathāvuso, bhikkhu vihāraṃ kappeti yathā yathāssa vihāraṃ kappayato bhaddakaṃ maraṇaṃ hoti, bhaddikā kālakiriyā.
an6.14:4.1.eng: A mendicant lives life so as to have a good death.

an6.14:4.2.pli: Kathañcāvuso, bhikkhu tathā tathā vihāraṃ kappeti yathā yathāssa vihāraṃ kappayato bhaddakaṃ maraṇaṃ hoti, bhaddikā kālakiriyā?
an6.14:4.2.eng: And how do they live life so as to have a good death?

an6.14:5.1.pli: Idhāvuso, bhikkhu na kammārāmo hoti na kammarato na kammārāmataṃ anuyutto, na bhassārāmo hoti na bhassarato na bhassārāmataṃ anuyutto, na niddārāmo hoti na niddārato na niddārāmataṃ anuyutto, na saṅgaṇikārāmo hoti na saṅgaṇikarato na saṅgaṇikārāmataṃ anuyutto, na saṃsaggārāmo hoti na saṃsaggarato na saṃsaggārāmataṃ anuyutto, na papañcārāmo hoti na papañcarato na papañcārāmataṃ anuyutto.
an6.14:5.1.eng: Take a mendicant who doesn’t relish work, talk, sleep, company, closeness, and proliferation. They don’t love these things or like to relish them.

an6.14:5.2.pli: Evaṃ kho, āvuso, bhikkhu tathā tathā vihāraṃ kappeti yathā yathāssa vihāraṃ kappayato bhaddakaṃ maraṇaṃ hoti, bhaddikā kālakiriyā.
an6.14:5.2.eng: A mendicant who lives life like this has a good death.

an6.14:5.4.pli: ‘bhikkhu nibbānābhirato pajahāsi sakkāyaṃ sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāyā’ti.
an6.14:5.4.eng: a mendicant who delights in extinguishment, who has given up substantial reality to rightly make an end of suffering.

an6.14:6.1.eng: A beast who likes to proliferate,

an6.14:6.4.eng: the supreme sanctuary from the yoke.

an6.14:7.1.eng: But one who gives up proliferation,

an6.14:7.4.eng: the supreme sanctuary from the yoke.”

an6.140:1.1.eng: “For insight into greed, six things should be developed.

an6.140:1.3.pli: Dassanānuttariyaṃ, savanānuttariyaṃ, lābhānuttariyaṃ, sikkhānuttariyaṃ, pāricariyānuttariyaṃ, anussatānuttariyaṃ.
an6.140:1.3.eng: The unsurpassable seeing, listening, acquisition, training, service, and recollection.

an6.140:1.4.pli: Rāgassa, bhikkhave, abhiññāya ime cha dhammā bhāvetabbā”ti.
an6.140:1.4.eng: For insight into greed, these six things should be developed.”

an6.141:1.1.eng: “For insight into greed, six things should be developed.

an6.141:1.3.pli: Buddhānussati, dhammānussati, saṅghānussati, sīlānussati, cāgānussati, devatānussati.
an6.141:1.3.eng: The recollection of the Buddha, the teaching, the Saṅgha, ethics, generosity, and the deities.

an6.141:1.4.pli: Rāgassa, bhikkhave, abhiññāya ime cha dhammā bhāvetabbā”ti.
an6.141:1.4.eng: For insight into greed, these six things should be developed.”

an6.142:1.1.eng: “For insight into greed, six things should be developed.

an6.142:1.3.pli: Aniccasaññā, anicce dukkhasaññā, dukkhe anattasaññā, pahānasaññā, virāgasaññā, nirodhasaññā.
an6.142:1.3.eng: The perception of impermanence, the perception of suffering in impermanence, the perception of not-self in suffering, the perception of giving up, the perception of fading away, and the perception of cessation.

an6.142:1.4.pli: Rāgassa, bhikkhave, abhiññāya ime cha dhammā bhāvetabbā”ti.
an6.142:1.4.eng: For insight into greed, these six things should be developed.”

an6.143-169:1.9.eng: letting go of greed these six things should be developed.”

an6.15:1.1.pli: Tatra kho āyasmā sāriputto bhikkhū āmantesi:

an6.15:1.2.pli: “tathā tathāvuso, bhikkhu vihāraṃ kappeti yathā yathāssa vihāraṃ kappayato kālakiriyā anutappā hoti.
an6.15:1.2.eng: “As a mendicant makes their bed, so they must lie in it, and die tormented by regrets.

an6.15:1.3.pli: Kathañcāvuso, bhikkhu tathā tathā vihāraṃ kappeti yathā yathāssa vihāraṃ kappayato kālakiriyā anutappā hoti?
an6.15:1.3.eng: And how do they die tormented by regrets?

an6.15:2.1.pli: Idhāvuso, bhikkhu kammārāmo hoti kammarato kammārāmataṃ anuyutto, bhassārāmo hoti …
an6.15:2.1.eng: Take a mendicant who relishes work, talk, sleep, company, closeness, and proliferation. They love these things and like to relish them.

an6.15:2.6.pli: Evaṃ kho, āvuso, bhikkhu tathā tathā vihāraṃ kappeti yathā yathāssa vihāraṃ kappayato kālakiriyā anutappā hoti.
an6.15:2.6.eng: A mendicant who makes their bed like this must lie in it, and die tormented by regrets.

an6.15:2.8.pli: ‘bhikkhu sakkāyābhirato nappajahāsi sakkāyaṃ sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāya’.
an6.15:2.8.eng: a mendicant who enjoys substantial reality, who hasn’t given up substantial reality to rightly make an end of suffering.

an6.15:3.1.pli: Tathā tathāvuso, bhikkhu vihāraṃ kappeti yathā yathāssa vihāraṃ kappayato kālakiriyā ananutappā hoti.
an6.15:3.1.eng: As a mendicant makes their bed, so they must lie in it, and die free of regrets.

an6.15:3.2.pli: Kathañcāvuso, bhikkhu tathā tathā vihāraṃ kappeti yathā yathāssa vihāraṃ kappayato kālakiriyā ananutappā hoti?
an6.15:3.2.eng: And how do they die free of regrets?

an6.15:4.1.pli: Idhāvuso, bhikkhu na kammārāmo hoti na kammarato na kammārāmataṃ anuyutto, na bhassārāmo hoti …
an6.15:4.1.eng: Take a mendicant who doesn’t relish work, talk, sleep, company, closeness, and proliferation. They don’t love these things or like to relish them.

an6.15:4.5.pli: na papañcārāmo hoti na papañcarato na papañcārāmataṃ anuyutto.

an6.15:4.6.pli: Evaṃ kho, āvuso, bhikkhu tathā tathā vihāraṃ kappeti yathā yathāssa vihāraṃ kappayato kālakiriyā ananutappā hoti.
an6.15:4.6.eng: A mendicant who makes their bed like this must lie in it, and die free of regrets.

an6.15:4.8.pli: ‘bhikkhu nibbānābhirato pajahāsi sakkāyaṃ sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāyā’ti.
an6.15:4.8.eng: a mendicant who delights in extinguishment, who has given up substantial reality to rightly make an end of suffering.

an6.15:5.1.eng: A beast who likes to proliferate,

an6.15:5.4.eng: the supreme sanctuary from the yoke.

an6.15:6.1.eng: But one who gives up proliferation,

an6.15:6.4.eng: the supreme sanctuary from the yoke.”
